statement:
Let $\mathbb{F}$ be an arbitrary field, and let $n$ be a positive
integer. Consider $\mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}),$ the vector space of all
$n \times n$ matrices over $\mathbb{F}.$ Define

-   $\mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F}) = \{A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}):\, {\rm tr} (A) = 0\},$

-   $\mathcal{N} = \{A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}):\, A\, \, \mbox{is nilpotent}\},$

-   $\mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F}) = \{A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}):\, \det (A) \neq 0\}.$

Notice that $\mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F})$ is a linear subspace of
$\mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F})$ and
$\mathcal{N} \subseteq \mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F}).$

The Botta – Pierce – Watkins theorem on linear preservers of the
nilpotent matrices [@BPW] can be formulated as follows.

Let
$\varphi : \mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F}) \longrightarrow \mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F})$
be a linear automorphism. Assume that
$\varphi (\mathcal{N}) \subseteq \mathcal{N}.$ Then either
$\exists\, P \in \mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F})\, \exists\, c \in \mathbb{F} \setminus \{0\}\, \forall\, A \in \mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F}) :\, \varphi (A) = c P A P^{-1},$
or
$\exists\, P \in \mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F})\, \exists\, c \in \mathbb{F} \setminus \{0\}\, \forall\, A \in \mathfrak{sl}_n (\mathbb{F}) :\, \varphi (A) = c P A^{\rm T} P^{-1}.$

The original proof is based on the Gerstenhaber - Serezhkin theorem,
some elementary algebraic geometry, and the fundamental theorem of
projective geometry.

[99]{} P. Botta, S. Pierce, W. Watkins, Linear transformations that
preserve the nilpotent matrices, *Pacific J. Math.* [**104**]{} (No. 1):
39–46 (1983).
